oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A novel perovskite-based proton conductor for solid oxide fuel cells
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: HARIHARAN, R
PRASANNA, TRS
GOPALAN, P
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Proton conduction
Electrical properties
Solid electrolyte
Perovskite oxide
Fuel cell materials
ELECTROLYTE
TRANSPORT
CA
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A perovskite-based electrolyte, Ca-substituted YAlO3, has been synthesized by the citrate gel process. The conductivity of Y0.9Ca0.1AlO3-delta has been studied by AC impedance spectroscopy in controlled atmospheres in the temperature range 300-800 degrees C. The material has been found to be a mixed conductor with dominant p-type electronic conduction at elevated temperatures and a combined protonic conduction below 600 degrees C in wet conditions. The H/D isotope effect on conductivity confirms the presence of protonic conductivity between 400 and 600 degrees C. (C) 2012 Acta Materialia Inc. Published by Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.
